thread.title: Benches clear in Cubs-Pirates wild-card game after Arrieta plunked
thread.title_full: Benches clear in Cubs-Pirates wild-card game after Arrieta plunked - CBSSports.com

author: Dayn Perry
title: Benches clear in Cubs-Pirates wild-card game after Arrieta plunked
text:
Tempers boiled over in the seventh inning of Wednesday night's NL wild-card game between the Cubs and Pirates ( CHC-PIT GameTracker ). Earlier in the game, Cubs starter Jake Arrieta , in the course of dominating the Pirates through the early and middle innings, nicked Francisco Cervelli with an up-and-in pitch and then hit Josh Harrison the next inning. 
When Arrieta came up in the seventh, Pirates reliever Tony Watson plunked Arrieta in the hip, and Arrieta took offense. Thereupon, the dugouts emptied, and a near-brawl broke out near home plate.
Your browser does not support iframes. 
Here's a screencap via @dayna1208 ... 

Another view ... 
After a little brush up on the field, Tony Watson gets the Bucs out of the 7th and we're in the stretch. #LETSGOBUCS pic.twitter.com/Rp4eRhoBc6 
â€” Pittsburgh Pirates (@Pirates) October 8, 2015 Sean Rodriguez was ejected for being one of the most visibly involved, and he went back the dugout and ritually abused a water cooler. 
Topics: Francisco Cervelli , Jake Arrieta , Josh Harrison , Sean Rodriguez , Tony Watson , Chicago Cubs , Pittsburgh Pirates , MLB
